posts.post_content: So undercosted you can quadruple its converted mana cost, halve the raw card advantage it gives, change it from an instant to a sorcery, and remove the admittedly seldom-used option of using it as a mill finisher, and *still* get [a card that occasionally saw tournament play](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sift).
posts.html:
So undercosted you can quadruple its converted mana cost, halve the raw card advantage it gives, change it from an instant to a sorcery, and remove the admittedly seldom-used option of using it as a mill finisher, and still get a card that occasionally saw tournament play.

Posted By: NoFatWizards (2/6/2012 12:54:14 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: From MaRo's column: "it’s important to note that Richard designed Alpha making a few assumptions that turned out to be way off base. The biggest one was the assumption that players would buy the equivalent of five starter decks and would only trade within their own small play group. In that scenario, cards like Ancestral Recall or the Moxes are nowhere nearly as degenerate."
posts.html:

When is [Dark Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Ritual) an Ancestral Recall? [Stroke of Genius](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stroke of Genius).  
When is [Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt) an Ancestral Recall? [Swans of Bryn Argoll](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Swans of Bryn Argoll).  
When is [Giant Growth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Giant Growth) an Ancestral Recall? [Garruk, Primal Hunter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Garruk, Primal Hunter).  
When is [Healing Salve](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Healing Salve) an Ancestral Recall? [Yawgmoth's Bargain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Yawgmoth's Bargain).  
When is [Ancestral Recall](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ancestral Recall) an Ancestral Recall? Every time.  
  
5/5.
